definition.name: NXdistortion
definition.doc: Draft subclass of NXprocess to describe post-processing distortion correction.

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays

symbol.name: nsym
symbol.doc: Number of symmetry points used for distortion correction

symbol.name: ndx
symbol.doc: Number of points of the matrix distortion field (x direction)

symbol.name: ndy
symbol.doc: Number of points of the matrix distortion field (y direction)

field.name: applied
field.doc: Has the distortion correction been applied?

field.name: symmetry
field.doc: For symmetry-guided distortion correction (https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0304399118303474?via%3Dihub), where a pattern of features is mapped to the regular geometric structure expected from the symmetry. Here we record the number of elementary symmetry operations.

field.name: original_centre
field.doc: For symmetry-guided distortion correction. Here we record the coordinates of the symmetry centre point.

field.name: original_points
field.doc: For symmetry-guided distortion correction. Here we record the coordinates of the relevant symmetry points.

field.name: cdeform_field
field.doc: Column deformation field for general non-rigid distortion corrections. 2D matrix holding the column information of the mapping of each original coordinate.

field.name: rdeform_field
field.doc: Row deformation field for general non-rigid distortion corrections. 2D matrix holding the row information of the mapping of each original coordinate.

group.doc: Class to describe freely the procedures employed.
